verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329> <WH8764>, A Psalm <WH4210> of David <WH1732>. O YY <WH3068>, thou hast searched <WH2713> <WH8804> me, and known <WH3045> <WH8799> me.
Thou knowest <WH3045> <WH8804> my downsitting <WH3427> <WH8800> and mine uprising <WH6965> <WH8800>, thou understandest <WH995> <WH8804> my thought <WH7454> afar off <WH7350>.
Thou compassest <WH2219> <WH8765> my path <WH734> and my lying down <WH7252>, and art acquainted <WH5532> <WH8689> with all my ways <WH1870>.
For there is not a word <WH4405> in my tongue <WH3956>, but, lo, O YY <WH3068>, thou knowest <WH3045> <WH8804> it altogether.
Thou hast beset <WH6696> <WH8804> me behind <WH268> and before <WH6924>, and laid <WH7896> <WH8799> thine hand <WH3709> upon me.
Such knowledge <WH1847> is too wonderful <WH6383> <WH8675> <WH6383> for me; it is high <WH7682> <WH8738>, I cannot <WH3201> <WH8799> attain unto it.
Whither shall I go <WH3212> <WH8799> from thy spirit <WH7307>? or whither shall I flee <WH1272> <WH8799> from thy presence <WH6440> ?
If I ascend up <WH5266> <WH8799> into heaven <WH8064>, thou art there: if I make my bed <WH3331> <WH8686> in SH'ol <WH7585>, behold, thou art there.
If I take <WH5375> <WH8799> the wings <WH3671> of the morning <WH7837>, and dwell <WH7931> <WH8799> in the uttermost parts <WH319> of the sea <WH3220>;
Havahn there shall thy hand <WH3027> lead <WH5148> <WH8686> me, and thy right hand <WH3225> shall hold <WH270> <WH8799> me.
If I say <WH559> <WH8799>, Surely the darkness <WH2822> shall cover <WH7779> <WH8799> me; even the night <WH3915> shall be light <WH216> about me <WH1157>.

Yea, the darkness <WH2822> hideth <WH2821> <WH8686> not from thee; but the night <WH3915> shineth <WH215> <WH8686> as the day <WH3117>: the darkness <WH2825> and the light <WH219> are both alike to thee.
For thou hast possessed <WH7069> <WH8804> my reins <WH3629>: thou hast covered <WH5526> <WH8799> me in my mother's <WH517> womb <WH990>.

I will praise <WH3034> <WH8686> thee; for I am fearfully <WH3372> <WH8737> and wonderfully made <WH6395> <WH8738>: marvellous <WH6381> <WH8737> are thy works <WH4639>; and that my soul <WH5315> knoweth <WH3045> <WH8802> right well <WH3966>.

My substance <WH6108> was not hid <WH3582> <WH8738> from thee, when I was made <WH6213> <WH8795> in secret <WH5643>, and curiously wrought <WH7551> <WH8795> in the lowest parts <WH8482> of the earth <WH776>.

Thine eyes <WH5869> did see <WH7200> <WH8804> my substance, yet being unperfect <WH1564>; and in thy book <WH5612> all my members were written <WH3789> <WH8735>, which in continuance <WH3117> were fashioned <WH3335> <WH8795>, when as yet there was none <WH259> of them.
How precious <WH3365> <WH8804> also are thy thoughts <WH7454> unto me, O 'Elohim <WH410> ! how great <WH6105> <WH8804> is the sum <WH7218> of them!
If I should count <WH5608> <WH8799> them, they are more in number <WH7235> <WH8799> than the sand <WH2344>: when I awake <WH6974> <WH8689>, I am still <WH5750> with thee.
Surely thou wilt slay <WH6991> <WH8799> the wicked <WH7563>, O 'Elohim <WH433>: depart <WH5493> <WH8798> from me therefore, ye bloody <WH1818> men <WH582>.
For they speak <WH559> <WH8799> against thee wickedly <WH4209>, and thine enemies <WH6145> take <WH5375> <WH8804> thy name in vain <WH7723>.
Do not I hate <WH8130> <WH8799> them, O YY <WH3068>, that hate <WH8130> <WH8764> thee? and am not I grieved <WH6962> <WH8709> with those that rise up <WH8618> against thee?
I hate <WH8130> <WH8804> them with perfect <WH8503> hatred <WH8135>: I count them mine enemies <WH341> <WH8802>.
Search <WH2713> <WH8798> me, O 'Elohim <WH410>, and know <WH3045> <WH8798> my heart <WH3824>: try <WH974> <WH8798> me, and know <WH3045> <WH8798> my thoughts <WH8312>:
And see <WH7200> <WH8798> if there be any wicked <WH6090> way <WH1870> in me, and lead <WH5148> <WH8798> me in the way <WH1870> everlasting <WH5769>.
